The Swiss based universal postal union warns American consumers will pay a heavy price if the Trump Administration goes ahead with its threat to pull out of an international postal treaty Lisa slain in Geneva reports the administration claims the treaty unfairly benefits China
The Trump Administration wants to renegotiate the treaty saying it allows China to nail small packages to America at heavily discounted rates making it hard for American business to compete
As senior postal union official warns Americans won't be able to send international letters or international packages if Washington points out that the one hundred forty four year old treaty he
Says the U.S won't be able to access special coats needed to send and receive mail internationally and this will affect UPS that ... and other companies who also would lose access to these codes for NPR News I'm Lisa shrine in Geneva
